intro: Pavia atropurpurea, commonly known as the purple pavia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from purple to pink, often with a contrasting yellow throat. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptic, with a rough texture and prominent veins. Pavia atropurpurea thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
